===Etymology 1===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょう'}} {{m|ltc|錠|tr={{IPAchar|/*diaŋ/}}}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} traditional {{m|cmn|錠}} and simplified {{m|cmn|锭|tr=dìng}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|じょ|う}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[d͡ʑʲo̞ː]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|鎖}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じょう|hhira=じやう}}

# a device used to make a door unopenable: a [[lock]]
#* {{RQ:Nippo Jisho|367}}<ref>{{R:Nippo Jisho}}</ref>
#*: '''Iŏ'''. ジャウ (鎖) 錠. 例, '''Iŏ'''uo vorosu. (鎖を下ろす) 錠をおろす. '''Iŏ'''uo aquru. (鎖を開くる) 錠をあける.

=====See also=====
* {{ja-l|鍵|かぎ|kagi}}: a [[key]]

===Etymology 2===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しょうまえ'|鎖|tr1=jō|t1=chain|前|tr2=mae|t2=front}}, in reference to the [[padlock]] on the front of a chain keeping a [[door]] or [[gate]] closed. The use of {{lang|ja|錠}} is an example of [[ateji]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|じょ|うまえ}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[d͡ʑʲo̞ːma̠e̞]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|錠前}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じょうまえ|hhira=ぢやうまへ}} {{lb|ja|sort=しょうまえ'|rare}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=しょうまえ'|錠前|dot=:}} a [[lock]], a [[padlock]]
